formattedAddress: 25 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 25 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA

editorialSummary.text: Korean grab-and-go joint with a small dining area, offering different styles of fried chicken and beer.

originalText.text:
We asked for hot and spicy wings. When I called to let them ask for additional sauce because these basically have no sauce, they told us we can come back tomorrow and pay extra for additional sauce?? Like yeah after I consume my dry chicken let me walk back and spend $3 more on extra sauce the next day. As if the wings aren’t already extraordinarily expensive.

Oh and the kicker is she literally told us they barely put any sauce because people were complaining about it being too spicy!?

text.text:

Like yeah after I consume my dry chicken let me walk back and spend $3 more on extra sauce the next day. As if the wings aren’t already extraordinarily expensive.

Oh and the kicker is she literally told us they barely put any sauce because people were complaining about it being too spicy!?

originalText.text: This place was unique. They have their entrees In little boxes, already prepared, with little stickers for the flavors. They had secret sauce, honey garlic and others. The chicken was very tender, had lots of sauce on the pieces and were a good portion size. I just wish that you could get a smaller portion sizes. The chicken was however , tender and delicious.

text.text: This place was unique. They have their entrees In little boxes, already prepared, with little stickers for the flavors. They had secret sauce, honey garlic and others. The chicken was very tender, had lots of sauce on the pieces and were a good portion size. I just wish that you could get a smaller portion sizes. The chicken was however , tender and delicious.

originalText.text: I had a late lunch at this restaurant, and it was still bustling with customers. The restaurant itself is spacious and minimalist, with no particular decorations. We ordered both traditional wings and boneless wings. The spicy flavor was delightfully fiery, and the aroma of garlic in the honey garlic chicken was enticing. The white rice served was fluffy and tender. However, the only drawback was the sauce on the chicken; it seemed that only a portion of the chicken pieces was adequately coated with sauce.

text.text: I had a late lunch at this restaurant, and it was still bustling with customers. The restaurant itself is spacious and minimalist, with no particular decorations. We ordered both traditional wings and boneless wings. The spicy flavor was delightfully fiery, and the aroma of garlic in the honey garlic chicken was enticing. The white rice served was fluffy and tender. However, the only drawback was the sauce on the chicken; it seemed that only a portion of the chicken pieces was adequately coated with sauce.

originalText.text:
Decent place to get Korean fried chicken. This location has the entire ground floor dedicated towards to-go orders, while the downstairs catered to dine-in.
As for the food, I definitely recommend bone-in variations over boneless, as the boneless ones felt over fried and dry. The sauces and flavors are solid, and not a bad place to have Korean fried chicken, but also definitely not the best place

originalText.text:
BB.Q Chicken NY K Town in New York is a culinary haven that elevates Korean fried chicken to an art form. The moment you step in, the aroma of perfectly seasoned and crisped chicken wafts through the air, setting the stage for a delightful dining experience.

What makes BB.Q Chicken stand out is its commitment to perfection. The fried chicken is a masterpiece, boasting a perfect balance of crunch and succulence. The diverse array of flavors, from the signature Golden Olive Chicken to the fiery Yangnyeom Chicken, caters to a spectrum of taste preferences.

The vibrant ambiance and modern décor create an inviting space to savor the delectable offerings. BB.Q Chicken is not just a restaurant; it's a celebration of Korean culinary excellence in the heart of New York City.

In summary, BB.Q Chicken NY K Town is a must-visit for food enthusiasts seeking an unforgettable Korean fried chicken experience. It stands as a beacon of flavorful delight in the diverse culinary landscape of New York.
